CustomField.description: Many webhooks use the same name for their objects, though the content may be different. Common examples of this are "Event", "User", "Message". This prefix allows you to create custom apex-defined objects with the same name, but distinguished by a prefix. Example: If you define the prefix "slack_", then all the custom apex-defined object "Event" would be "slack_Event".
CustomField.inlineHelpText: Many webhooks use the same name for their objects, though the content may be different. Common examples of this are "Event", "User", "Message". This prefix allows you to create custom apex-defined objects with the same name, but distinguished by a prefix. Example: If you define the prefix "slack_", then all the custom apex-defined object "Event" would be "slack_Event".
CustomField.label: Custom Object Prefix
